intro: Senecio hoffmannii, commonly known as Hoffmann's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
